chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Thomas J Reisen was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Thomas J Reisen was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Thomas J Reisen was found guilty of Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Thomas J Reisen was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay $1200 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay.

10 days of sentence are stayed. If Defendant attends the Victim Impact Panel scheduled for 6/9/16, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to attend, stay will be lifted. Good time and Huber privileges granted. Report forthwith.
Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.
Obtain alcohol assessment through Door County Human Services and comply with treatment recommendations.
Defendant is required to attend the Victim Impact Panel scheduled for 6/9/16.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment as determined by Dept. of Corrections.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Write minimum 500 word apology to deputies and police officers. Submit DNA sample.

Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas J Reisen in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that he will be representing Defendant despite Court's signature on order granting withdrawal. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 3, 4, 5. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 3, 4, 5. Count 2, 6 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Defense/Defendant agree with 2 prior convictions. Bond no longer in effect.
for Leave to Withdraw as Counsel

Defendant Thomas J Reisen in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Originally set for plea hearing. Court reviews previous activity. Defense requests extension, advises that Defendant was just offered job at Evenson Laundry, needs time to get Huber set up.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Thomas J Reisen in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that case be set for plea/sentencing. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Thomas J Reisen in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another status conference, advises of extensive medical records that have been requested but not received, requests 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Thomas J Reisen in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint and Amended Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense enters not guilty pleas.  Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center. Not to drive at all.

Defendant Thomas J. Reisen appears by video along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
